title: DOJ Moves to Undermine Independence of Regulatory Agencies
summary: The Department of Justice announced plans to challenge the constitutional protections that prevent the president from arbitrarily firing leaders of independent agencies like the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and National Labor Relations Board (NLRB). Acting Solicitor General Sarah Harris argued that current laws protecting agency leadership are unconstitutional, potentially opening the door to direct executive branch interference in regulatory bodies.
description: The Department of Justice challenged the constitutional basis for independent regulatory agencies, arguing that agency heads should be removable at will by the president. This move targets the FTC, NLRB, and CPSC, potentially allowing direct executive control over these previously independent bodies.
